intro: Juncus fontanesii subsp. kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi rush, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems that grow in dense clusters, typically reaching heights of up to 60 cm. The plant produces small, pale green to brownish flowers in spike-like inflorescences during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
